concept.title: Configuring Advanced Settings
concept.abstract: Advanced settings include configurations for the Group Feature Settings, Group Roster Settings, Group Search, Member Search and Profile, and Social Media. Staff users define the fields used for filtering search results displayed in the Tile and Group Profile view. Navigate to the Custom Object page in Setup to retrieve field API names. Additionally, all external links must be from a secured site.

section.p:
Enable the desired Group Feature Settings to display the available tabs to portal users:
Enable Community Feed- Displays the Community Feed tab on the Group Detail page. In a Public Group, the Community Feed is displayed to authenticated portal users by default. Private and Unlisted Groups display the Community Feed to members only.
Enable Members- Displays the Members tab on the Group Detail page. In both Public and Private Groups, the Members tab is displayed to all Community Portal users by default. Unlisted Groups display the Members tab to members only.
Enable Events- Displays the Events tab on the Group Detail page. In a Public Group, the Events tab is displayed to all Community Portal users by default. Private and Unlisted Groups display the Events tab to members only. All Group Feature Settings are enabled by default. Disabling a feature will remove the tab from the Group Detail page in the Community Portal. Unauthenticated portal users do not have access to the Community Feed.

Group Owners can insert a Group Roster button that links to a custom Roster page by enabling Show Group Roster and configuring the related fields:
Group Roster Label-Enter the text for the button label
Group Roster Link-Enter the external link that redirects portal users when clicking the Group Roster button.
Group Owners can customize the Groups Search page on the Site record.

ul.li: Show Group Search Filters-Enables the sidebar on the Groups Search page. Enabled by default.

Group Search Filters (CSV)-References the field set that defines the attributes portal users can use to filter search results using comma separated values of field API names. Only for Community Group fields.
Group Search Page Results-Defines the maximum number of results returned for search queries. The default is set to 10.
Group Search Default Sort Field-Sorts group search results in ascending or descending order. The Group Name is the default. Only for Community Group fields.
Group Search Results Sort Order-Displays the order of the search results. The default is set ASC.

Group Search Result Display Fields (CSV)-References the field set that displays on the each Group's tile on the Groups Search page using comma separated values of field API names. Only for Community Group fields.

conbody.section:
The Group Owner can customize Group Members' experience in the Community Portal by configuring the Community Group Member Search Settings on the Community Group record:
Show Search Filters-Enables the sidebar on the Group Members Search page.
Member Search Filter Fields (CSV)-Defines the Group Member field API names that display in the sidebar on the Group Members Search page. Must be configured prior to enabling Show Search Filters.
Group Member View Field Sets (CSV) - References the field set that defines the attributes displayed on the Group Member profile.
Group Member Edit Field Sets (CSV) - References the field set that defines the attributes that can be updated by Group Members in the Community Portal.
Member Search Display Fields (CSV)-Defines the fields displayed in the Group Member tiles on the Group Members Search page using comma separated values of field API names.
Search Results Sort Field-Defines the field to sort Group Member search results in ascending or descending order. Default is set to Name.
Search Results Sort Order-Defines the order in which the search results will be displayed. The default is set to ASC.
Search Results-Defines the maximum number of results that are returned for Group Member search results. The default is set to 10.
Staff users can change the fields within the sidebar visible to users on the Members tab by configuring the Search Filters on the Community Group record. To configure the Group Member View Field Sets (CSV) and Group Member Edit Field Sets (CSV) fields, create a field set.

Social Media
Populate the social media fields for them to appear on the Banner image of the Group Detail page. Supported social media links:
Twitter Profile URL
Google+ Profile URL
Facebook Profile URL
LinkedIn Profile URL
Authenticated and unauthenticated portal users can click the social media icons on the Group Detail page to return the URL defined on the Community Group record in a separate tab in the browser window.
